pull.title: wallet: For feebump, ignore abandoned descendant spends
pull.body:
Closes #26667

To be eligible for fee-bumping, a transaction must not have any of its outputs (eg - change) spent in other unconfirmed transactions in the wallet. This behavior is currently [enforced](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/9e229a542ff2107be43eff2e4b992841367f0366/src/wallet/feebumper.cpp#L25-L28) and [tested](https://github.com/bitcoin/bitcoin/blob/9e229a542ff2107be43eff2e4b992841367f0366/test/functional/wallet_bumpfee.py#L270-L286). 

However, this check shouldn't apply to spends in abandoned descendant transactions, as explained by #26667. 

`CWallet::IsSpent` already carves out an exception for abandoned transactions, so we can just use that.

I've also added a new test to cover this case.

events.message:
For feebump, ignore abandoned descendant spends

To be eligible for fee-bumping, a transaction must not have any
of its outputs (eg - change) spent in other unconfirmed transactions
in the wallet. However, this check should not apply to abandoned
transactions.

A new test case is added to cover this case.

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -286,6 +287,39 @@ def test_bumpfee_with_descendant_fails(self, rbf_node, rbf_node_address, dest_ad
     self.clear_mempool()
 
 
+def test_bumpfee_with_abandoned_descendant_succeeds(self, rbf_node, dest_address):
+    self.log.info('Test that fee can be bumped when it has abandoned descendant')
+    parent_id = spend_one_input(rbf_node, dest_address, Decimal("0.00049000"))
+    # Find change output
+    output_list = rbf_node.getrawtransaction(parent_id, 1)["vout"]
+    change_output = next(o for o in output_list if o["value"] == Decimal("0.00049000"))
+
+    # Submit child transaction with low fee
+    child = rbf_node.createrawtransaction([{"txid": parent_id, "vout": change_output["n"]}], {dest_address: 0.0004850})
comments.body: Might be easier to use the `send` RPC?

comments.diff_hunk:
@@ -286,6 +287,39 @@ def test_bumpfee_with_descendant_fails(self, rbf_node, rbf_node_address, dest_ad
     self.clear_mempool()
 
 
+def test_bumpfee_with_abandoned_descendant_succeeds(self, rbf_node, dest_address):
+    self.log.info('Test that fee can be bumped when it has abandoned descendant')
+    parent_id = spend_one_input(rbf_node, dest_address, Decimal("0.00049000"))
+    # Find change output
+    output_list = rbf_node.getrawtransaction(parent_id, 1)["vout"]
+    change_output = next(o for o in output_list if o["value"] == Decimal("0.00049000"))
+
+    # Submit child transaction with low fee
+    child = rbf_node.createrawtransaction([{"txid": parent_id, "vout": change_output["n"]}], {dest_address: 0.0004850})
comments.body: Happy to change it, but I picked this because `send` is marked as "EXPERIMENTAL warning: this call may be changed in future releases". I do see other uses of it in tests, though.
